WheelEvent.summary: The WheelEvent interface represents events that occur due to the user moving a mouse wheel or similar input device.

blockquote.para: This is the standard wheel event interface to use. Old versions of browsers implemented the non-standard and non-cross-browser-compatible MouseWheelEvent and interfaces. Use this interface and avoid the non-standard ones.

remarks.para: Don't confuse the wheel event with the event:

- event
-Interfaces replaced by this one:-Gecko's legacy mouse wheel event object:

WheelEventWheelEvent.summary: The WheelEvent() constructor returns a new object.

blockquote.para:
If you construct a synthetic event using this constructor, that event will not be trusted, for security reasons.
Only browser-generated WheelEvent objects are trusted and only trusted events trigger default actions.

WheelEventDeltaX.summary:
The WheelEvent.deltaX read-only property is a
double representing the horizontal scroll amount in the
unit.

remarks.para: You must check the deltaMode property to determine the unit of the deltaX value. Do not assume that the deltaX value is specified in pixels. Some browsers, for compatibility reasons, may return different units for the deltaX value depending on whether deltaMode has been accessed, to accommodate for websites not explicitly checking the deltaMode property.

WheelEventDeltaZ.summary:
The WheelEvent.deltaZ read-only property is a
double representing the scroll amount along the z-axis, in the
unit.

remarks.para: You must check the deltaMode property to determine the unit of the deltaZ value. Do not assume that the deltaZ value is specified in pixels. Some browsers, for compatibility reasons, may return different units for the deltaZ value depending on whether deltaMode has been accessed, to accommodate for websites not explicitly checking the deltaMode property.

WheelEventDeltaMode.summary:
The WheelEvent.deltaMode read-only property returns an
unsigned long representing the unit of the delta values scroll amount.
Permitted values are:

td.para: The delta values are specified in pixels.
The delta values are specified in lines.
The delta values are specified in pages.

remarks.para: You must check the deltaMode property to determine the unit of the deltaX, deltaY, and deltaZ values. Do not assume that those values are specified in pixels. Some browsers, for compatibility reasons, may return different units for the delta* values depending on whether deltaMode has been accessed, to accommodate for websites not explicitly checking the deltaMode property.
